column4: Hello, I have a Radeon X600 graphics card. How do I install the proprietary drivers for this device?
go to administrator and then hardware drivers
unfortunately it is still not an option, I just tried updating like you said.
If you know the filename, I think I could install it manually.
i have the same problem but after reboot after the update and the upgrade i installed the drivers some times ubuntu need just a lil bit more time :P
try rebooting and come back we will try smt else :P
OK, I'm installing xorg-driver-fglx, I think this is the right one.
when you activate the effects does it start to install the drivers??
No. My effects work without the 3d driver. However, to use programs like blender, google earth, and 3d games I need the driver. I've been through quite a bit of working with this in the past.
lol you must have 3d for compiz
The default drivers work fine with compiz
it seems like you have installed the drivers when you were installing the ubuntu
i know it does this with intel 950 chipset
When I put in a totally clean, un-used ubuntu live CD, the compiz drivers work fine.
so i think you are ok
i think you have the drivers
